attributes.action: Allow student paramedics to be allowed placement experience during the pandemic.
attributes.additional_details: In times of war(Covid), if the government decides to not train new recruits(Paramedics) in how to deal with this war due to pressure, resources, and priority; when the army is defeated or a new pandemic arrises and new recruits must join the battle, they'll be ill-equipped and will loose; causing more pressure, fewer resources and ultimately defeat. It's the government's job to think ahead strategically to ensure student paramedics experience this pandemic to learn and prevent future pandemics.
attributes.background: The new generation of paramedics must be effectively trained and experienced in pandemics. When a pandemic happens and we're brushed aside, it will mean the next generation will be ill-equipped to handle another pandemic. Training during hard times is the best way to prevent another hard time.

rejection.details: Decisions about teaching including placements are a matter for individual educational providers and the NHS, not the UK Government or Parliament.
